data.message: Why do some pages have a reply option within a thread, so you can reply directly to a post, and other pages don't have this function?

replies.message: Hi Rhonda. Pages can choose whether other people can post on their Timeline. If you're not seeing the option to reply on a Page, they might have it turned off. Learn more at: http://on.fb.me/1s9RzzY  -Ryan

I don't mean the privacy options.  I mean the blue clickable words right under the comment.  Some pages have 'Reply' next to 'Like'.  The 'Reply' is a blue clickable link  For instance, this page (Facebook) has the 'reply' option so you can reply directly to the comment.  If you click reply, your comment is indented to show that you are replying to a specific person in the thread.   We can not figure out how to have this option on our pages for friends.  all comments automatically go at the end of a thread no matter which comment you are replying to.
